info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 2:07AM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...Gusty thunderstorm outflow will impact portions of Riverside and eastern San Diego Counties through 315 AM PDT... At 205 AM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a gust front over western Imperial County, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Surface observations. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Areas of blowing dust can reduce visibility at times, making driving difficult. Locations impacted include... Indio, northern Palm Springs, Coachella, Borrego Springs, I-8 Between Boulevard And Imperial County Line, Hwy 78 Between S2 And Borrego Springs Rd, Hwy 78 Between Borrego Springs Rd And Ocotillo Wells, Hwy 78 Between Banner And S2, Mt San Jacinto State Park, I-8 Between Pine Valley And Boulevard, Cathedral City, Palm Desert, Desert Hot Springs, Rancho Mirage, Hwy S2 Between Shelter Valley And Agua Caliente, Hwy S22 Between Borrego Springs And Imperial County Line, Hwy S2 Vallecito Creek Rd, Ocotillo Wells, and Hwy S2 Between Canebrake And Imperial County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
